abstract: Researchers determine that Curtis Bauske, young soccer player who died of accidental overdose of prescription drugs, had Stage 2 chronic traumatic encephalopathy, degenerative brain disease linked to concussions; Bauske's death highlights risk to athletes in any contact and collision sport.
lead_paragraph: The case of Curtis Baushke, who was knocked unconscious three times in 14 years while playing soccer, highlights the risks beyond boxing and football.

headline.main: An Athlete Felled by Concussions, Despite Playing a ‘Safer’ Sport
headline.print_headline: Playing a Safer Sport, and Paying the Price

snippet: The case of Curtis Baushke, who was knocked unconscious three times in 14 years while playing soccer, highlights the risks beyond boxing and football.
